intro: Bellidastrum bellidiastrum, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and prefers partial to full shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem, while the flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Bellidastrum bellidiastrum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a food source for pollinators.
